revision.text:
{{short description|Wikipedia list article}} [[Image:Female nobel laureates.png|thumb|500px|All Nobel Prizes won by women (1901–2019)]] {{Women in society sidebar}} As of 2019, [[Nobel Prize]]s have been awarded to 866 men, 53 women ([[Marie Curie]] won it twice), and 24 unique organizations.{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/facts/nobel-prize-facts/|title=Nobel Prize facts|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2018-10-17}} The distribution of female Nobel Laureates is as follows:{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/lists/women.html|title=Nobel Laureates Facts - Women|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2017-10-07}}{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/economics/laureates/2009|title=Economics 2009|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|author=|date=2009-10-12|accessdate=2009-10-12}} * seventeen women have won the Nobel Peace Prize, * fifteen have won the Nobel Prize in Literature, * twelve have won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, * five have won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry, * three have won the Nobel Prize in Physics, * and two, [[Elinor Ostrom]] and [[Esther Duflo]], have won the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences. The first woman to win a Nobel Prize was [[Marie Curie]], who won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1903 with her husband, [[Pierre Curie]], and [[Henri Becquerel]].{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1903/|title=Nobel Prize in Physics 1903|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} Curie is also the only woman to have won multiple Nobel Prizes; in 1911, she won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry. Curie's daughter, [[Irène Joliot-Curie]], won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1935, making the two the only mother-daughter pair to have won Nobel Prizes. The most Nobel Prizes awarded to women in a single year was in 2009, when five women became laureates in four categories. The most recent women to be awarded a Nobel Prize were [[Esther Duflo]] in Economics (2019), [[Donna Strickland]] in Physics, [[Frances Arnold]] in Chemistry, [[Nadia Murad]] for Peace, and [[Olga Tokarczuk]] in Literature (2018). ==Laureates== {|class="wikitable sortable" width="98%" style="background:#ffffff;" |- ! Year !! class="unsortable" width="75px"|Image !! width="250px"|Laureate !! width="150px"|Country !! width="150px"|Category !! class="unsortable" | Rationale |- | align="center" | 1903 | [[Image:Marie Curie.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Marie Skłodowska|Curie}}
(shared with [[Pierre Curie]] and [[Henri Becquerel]]) | [[Poland]] and [[France]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physics|Physics]] | "in recognition of the extraordinary services they have rendered by their joint researches on the radiation phenomena discovered by Professor [[Henri Becquerel]]" |- | align="center" | 1905 | [[Image:Bertha von Suttner nobel.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Bertha von|Suttner}} | [[Austria–Hungary]] | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | Honorary President of [[International Peace Bureau|Permanent International Peace Bureau]], [[Bern]], [[Switzerland]]; Author of ''Lay Down Your Arms''.{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1905/|title=Nobel Peace Prize 1905|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1909 | [[Image:Selma Lagerlöf.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Selma|Lagerlöf||Lagerlof, Selma}} | [[Sweden]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] | "in appreciation of the lofty idealism, vivid imagination and spiritual perception that characterize her writings"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/1909/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 1909|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1911 | [[Image:Marie Curie.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Marie Skłodowska|Curie}} | [[Poland]] and [[France]] | [[Nobel Prize in Chemistry|Chemistry]] | "for her discovery of [[radium]] and [[polonium]]"{{cite web | title = The Nobel Prize in Chemistry 1911 | publisher = [[Nobel Foundation]] | url = http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/1911/index.html|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1926 | [[File:Grazia Deledda 1926.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Grazia|Deledda}} | [[Italy]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] | "for her idealistically inspired writings which with plastic clarity picture the life on her native island and with depth and sympathy deal with human problems in general"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/1926/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 1926|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1928 | [[Image:Sigrid Undset 1928.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Sigrid|Undset}} | [[Norway]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] | "principally for her powerful descriptions of Northern life during the Middle Ages"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/1928/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 1928|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1931 | [[Image:Jane Addams profile.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Jane|Addams}}
(shared with [[Nicholas Murray Butler]]) | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | Sociologist; International President, [[Women's International League for Peace and Freedom]].{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1931/|title=Nobel Peace Prize 1931|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1935 | [[Image:Irène Joliot-Curie Harcourt.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Irène|Joliot-Curie||Joliot-Curie, Irene}}
(shared with [[Frédéric Joliot-Curie]]) | [[France]] | [[Nobel Prize in Chemistry|Chemistry]] | "for their synthesis of new [[Radionuclide|radioactive]] elements"{{cite web | title = The Nobel Prize in Chemistry 1935 | publisher = [[Nobel Foundation]] | url = http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/1935/index.html|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1938 | [[Image:Pearl Buck 1972.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Pearl S.|Buck}} | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] | "for her rich and truly epic descriptions of peasant life in China and for her biographical masterpieces"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/1938/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 1938|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1945 | [[Image:Gabriela Mistral-01.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Gabriela|Mistral}} | [[Chile]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] | "for her lyric poetry which, inspired by powerful emotions, has made her name a symbol of the idealistic aspirations of the entire Latin American world"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/1945/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 1945|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1946 | [[Image:EmilyGreeneBalch.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Emily Greene|Balch}}
(shared with [[John Mott|John Raleigh Mott]]) | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | Formerly Professor of History and Sociology; Honorary International President, Women's International League for Peace and Freedom.{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1946/|title=Nobel Peace Prize 1946|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1947 | [[Image:Gerty Theresa Cori.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Gerty Theresa|Cori|Gerty Cori}}
(shared with [[Carl Ferdinand Cori]] and [[Bernardo Houssay]]) | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]] | "for their discovery of the course of the catalytic conversion of [[glycogen]]"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/1947/|title=Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1947|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1963 | [[Image:Maria Goeppert-Mayer.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Maria|Goeppert-Mayer}}
(shared with [[J. Hans D. Jensen]] and [[Eugene Wigner]]) | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physics|Physics]] | "for their discoveries concerning nuclear shell structure"{{cite web | title = The Nobel Prize in Physics 1963 | publisher = [[Nobel Foundation]] | url = http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/laureates/1963/index.html|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1964 | [[Image:Dorothy Hodgkin Nobel.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Dorothy Crowfoot|Hodgkin|Dorothy Hodgkin}} | [[United Kingdom]] | [[Nobel Prize in Chemistry|Chemistry]] | "for her determinations by [[Crystallography|X-ray techniques]] of the structures of important biochemical substances"{{cite web | title = The Nobel Prize in Chemistry 1964 | publisher = [[Nobel Foundation]] | url = http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/1964/index.html|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1966 | [[Image:Nelly Sachs 1966.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Nelly|Sachs}}
(shared with [[Samuel Agnon]]) | [[Sweden]] and [[Germany]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] | "for her outstanding lyrical and dramatic writing, which interprets Israel's destiny with touching strength"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/1966/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 1966|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" rowspan="2" | 1976 | [[Image:Betty Williams.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Betty|Williams|Betty Williams (Nobel laureate)}} | rowspan="2" | [[United Kingdom]] | rowspan="2" | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | rowspan="2" | Founder of the Northern Ireland Peace Movement (later renamed Community of Peace People){{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1976/|title=Nobel Peace Prize 1976|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | [[File:Mairead Corrigan Gaza.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Mairead|Maguire}} |- | align="center" | 1977 | [[File:Rosalyn Yalow - portrait.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Rosalyn|Sussman Yalow}}
(shared with [[Roger Guillemin]] and [[Andrew Schally]]) | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]] | "for the development of [[radioimmunoassay]]s of [[peptide hormone]]s"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/1977/|title=Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1977|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1979 | [[Image:MotherTeresa 090.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Mother|Teresa}} | [[India]] and
[[Yugoslavia]] | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | Leader of [[Missionaries of Charity]], [[Kolkata|Calcutta]].{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1979/|title=Nobel Peace Prize 1979|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1982 | [[Image:ARB-Alva-Myrdal.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Alva|Myrdal}}
(shared with [[Alfonso García Robles]]) | [[Sweden]] | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | Former Cabinet Minister; Diplomat; Writer.{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1982/|title=Nobel Peace Prize 1982|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1983 | [[File:Barbara McClintock (1902-1992).jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Barbara|McClintock}} | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]] | "for her discovery of [[Transposon|mobile genetic elements]]"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/1983/|title=Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1983|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1986 | [[Image:Rita Levi Montalcini.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Rita|Levi-Montalcini}}
(shared with [[Stanley Cohen (biochemist)|Stanley Cohen]]) | [[Italy]] and
[[United States]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]] | "for their discoveries of [[growth factor]]s"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/1986/|title=Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1986|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1988 | [[Image:Nci-vol-8236-300 Gertrude Elion.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Gertrude B.|Elion}}
(shared with [[James W. Black]] and [[George H. Hitchings]]) | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]] | "for their discoveries of important principles for [[Pharmacology|drug treatment]]"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/1988/|title=Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1988|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" rowspan="2" | 1991 | [[File:Nadine Gordimer 01.JPG|75px]] | {{sortname|Nadine|Gordimer}} | [[South Africa]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] | "who through her magnificent epic writing has - in the words of Alfred Nobel - been of very great benefit to humanity"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/1991/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 1991|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | [[Image:Remise du Prix Sakharov à Aung San Suu Kyi Strasbourg 22 octobre 2013-18.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Aung San|Suu Kyi}} | [[Burma]] | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | "for her non-violent struggle for democracy and human rights"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1991/|title=Nobel Peace Prize 1991|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1992 | [[Image:Rigoberta Menchu 2009 cropped.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Rigoberta|Menchú||Menchu, Rigoberta}} | [[Guatemala]] | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | "in recognition of her work for social justice and ethno-cultural reconciliation based on respect for the rights of indigenous peoples"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1992/|title=Nobel Peace Prize 1992|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1993 | [[Image:Toni Morrison 2008-2.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Toni|Morrison}} | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] | "who in novels characterized by visionary force and poetic import, gives life to an essential aspect of American reality"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/1993/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 1993|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1995 | [[Image:Christiane Nüsslein-Volhard mg 4383.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Christiane|Nüsslein-Volhard||Nusslein-Volhard, Christiane}}
(shared with [[Edward B. Lewis]] and [[Eric F. Wieschaus]]) | [[Germany]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]] | "for their discoveries concerning the genetic control of early [[Embryogenesis|embryonic development]]"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/1995/|title=Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1995|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1996 | [[Image:Szymborska 2011 (1).jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Wisława|Szymborska||Szymborska, Wislawa}} | [[Poland]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] | "for poetry that with ironic precision allows the historical and biological context to come to light in fragments of human reality"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/1996/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 1996|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 1997 | [[Image:JodyWilliamsMay2010.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Jody|Williams}}
(shared with the [[International Campaign to Ban Landmines]]) | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | "for their work for the banning and clearing of anti-personnel mines"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/1997/|title=Nobel Peace Prize 1997|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2012-09-09}} |- | align="center" | 2003 | [[Image:Shirin-Ebadi-Amsterdam-2011-Photo-by-Persian-Dutch-Network.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Shirin|Ebadi}} | [[Iran]] | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | "for her efforts for democracy and human rights. She has focused especially on the struggle for the rights of women and children"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/2003/|title=Nobel Peace Prize 2003|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" rowspan="3" | 2004 | [[Image:Elfriede jelinek 2004 small.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Elfriede|Jelinek}} | [[Austria]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] | "for her musical flow of voices and counter-voices in novels and plays that with extraordinary linguistic zeal reveal the absurdity of society's clichés and their subjugating power"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/2004/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 2004|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | [[Image:Wangari Maathai portrait by Martin Rowe.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Wangari|Maathai}} | [[Kenya]] | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | "for her contribution to sustainable development, democracy and peace"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/2004/|title=Nobel Peace Prize 2004|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | [[Image:LindaBuck cropped 1.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Linda B.|Buck}}
(shared with [[Richard Axel]]) | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]] | "for their discoveries of [[Olfactory receptor|odorant receptor]]s and the organization of the [[olfactory system]]"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/2004/|title=Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 2004|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 2007 | [[Image:Doris lessing 20060312 (square).jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Doris|Lessing}} | [[United Kingdom]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] | "that epicist of the female experience, who with scepticism, fire and visionary power has subjected a divided civilisation to scrutiny"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/2007/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 2007|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" | 2008 | [[Image:Françoise Barré-Sinoussi-press conference Dec 06th, 2008-1.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Françoise|Barré-Sinoussi||Barre-Sinoussi, Francoise}}
(shared with [[Harald zur Hausen]] and [[Luc Montagnier]]) | [[France]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]] | "for their discovery of HIV, [[HIV|human immunodeficiency virus]]"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/2008/|title=Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 2008|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2008-10-16}} |- | align="center" rowspan="5" | 2009 | [[Image:Elizabeth Blackburn CHF Heritage Day 2012 Rush 001.JPG|75px]] | {{sortname|Elizabeth|Blackburn}}
(shared with [[Jack W. Szostak]]) | [[Australia]] and [[United States]] | rowspan="2" | [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]] | rowspan="2" | "for the discovery of how chromosomes are protected by telomeres and the enzyme telomerase"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/2009/|title=Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 2009|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2009-10-05}} |- | [[Image:GREIDER Carol 2014 - Less vignetting.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Carol W.|Greider}}
(shared with [[Jack W. Szostak]]) | [[United States]] |- | [[File:Ada E. Yonath.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Ada E.|Yonath|Ada Yonath}}
(shared with [[Venkatraman Ramakrishnan]] and [[Thomas A. Steitz]]) | [[Israel]] | [[Nobel Prize in Chemistry|Chemistry]] |"for studies of the structure and function of the ribosome"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/2009/|title=Nobel Prize in Chemistry 2009|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2009-10-07}} |- | [[File:Müller, Herta.IMG 9379 cropped.JPG|75px]] | {{sortname|Herta|Müller||Muller, Herta}} | [[Germany]] and [[Romania]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] |"who, with the concentration of poetry and the frankness of prose, depicts the landscape of the dispossessed"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/2009/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 2009|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2009-10-08}} |- | [[Image:Nobel Prize 2009-Press Conference KVA-30.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Elinor|Ostrom|}}
(shared with [[Oliver E. Williamson]]) | [[United States]] | [[Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences|Economics]] |"for her analysis of economic governance, especially the commons"{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/economics/laureates/2009/|title=Nobel Prize in Economics 2009|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2009-10-12}} |- | align="center" rowspan="3" | 2011 | [[File:Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf, April 2010.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Ellen|Johnson Sirleaf|}} | rowspan="2" | [[Liberia]] | rowspan="3" | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] | rowspan="3" | "For their non-violent struggle for the safety of women and for [[women's rights]] to full participation in peace-building work"{{cite web |url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/2011/press.html |title=The Nobel Peace Prize 2011 |publisher=Nobel Foundation |accessdate=2011-10-07}} |- | [[File:Leymah-gbowee-at-emu-press-conference.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Leymah|Gbowee}} |- | [[File:Tawakkul Karman (Munich Security Conference 2012).jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Tawakkol|Karman}} | [[Yemen]] |- | align="center" | 2013 | [[File:Alice Munro.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Alice|Munro}} | [[Canada]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] |"master of the contemporary short story"{{cite web |url=https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/2013/press.pdf |title=The Nobel Prize in Literature 2013 |publisher=Nobel Foundation |format=PDF |accessdate=2013-10-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131012073434/http://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/2013/press.pdf |archive-date=2013-10-12 |url-status=dead }} |- | align="center" rowspan="2" | 2014 | [[File:May-Britt Moser 2014.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|May-Britt|Moser}}
(shared with [[Edvard Moser]] and [[John O'Keefe (neuroscientist)|John O'Keefe]]) | [[Norway]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]] | "for their discoveries of cells that constitute a positioning system in the brain"{{cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/2014/press.html |title=The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 2014 |publisher=Nobel Foundation |accessdate=2014-10-07}} |- | [[File:Malala Yousafzai at Girl Summit 2014.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Malala|Yousafzai|Malala Yousafzai}}
(shared with [[Kailash Satyarthi]]) | [[Pakistan]] | [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] |"for their struggle against the suppression of children and young people and for the right of all children to education".{{cite web |url=https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/2014/press.pdf |title=The Nobel Peace Prize 2014 |publisher=Nobel Foundation |accessdate=2014-10-10 }}{{dead link|date=October 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} |- | align="center" rowspan="2" | 2015 | [[File:Tu Youyou 5012-1-2015.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Tu|Youyou}}
(shared with [[William C. Campbell (scientist)|William C. Campbell]] and [[Satoshi Ōmura]]) | [[China]] | [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]] |"for her discoveries concerning a novel therapy against Malaria ([[artemisinin]])"{{cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/2015/press.pdf |title=The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 2015 |publisher=Nobel Foundation|format=PDF |accessdate=2015-10-05}} |- | [[File:Swetlana Alexandrowna Alexijewitsch.jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Svetlana|Alexievich|Svetlana Alexievich}} | [[Belarus]] | [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] |"for her polyphonic writings, a monument to suffering and courage in our time"{{cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/2015/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 2015|publisher=Nobel Foundation|accessdate=8 October 2015}} |- | align="center" rowspan="4" | 2018 |[[File:Donna Strickland - 2017 (cropped).jpg|75px]] |{{sortname|Donna|Strickland}}
(shared with [[Gérard Mourou]] and [[Arthur Ashkin]]) |[[Canada]] |[[Physics]] |"for their method of generating [[Chirped pulse amplification|high-intensity, ultra-short optical pulses]]"{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/2018/|title=The Nobel Prize in Physics 2018|publisher=Nobel Foundation|access-date=13 October 2018}} |- |[[File:Frances Arnold 2012.png|75px]] |{{sortname|Frances|Arnold}}
(shared with [[Greg Winter|Gregory Winter]] and [[George P. Smith (chemist)|George Smith]]) |[[United States]] |[[Chemistry]] |"for the directed evolution of [[Enzyme|enzymes]]"{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/10/03/science/chemistry-nobel-prize.html|title=Nobel Prize in Chemistry Is Awarded to 3 Scientists for Using Evolution in Design of Molecules|access-date=3 October 2018}} |- |[[File:Nadia Murad in Washington - 2018 (42733243785) (cropped).jpg|75px]] |{{sortname|Nadia|Murad}}
(shared with [[Denis Mukwege]]) |[[Iraq]] |[[Peace]] |"for their efforts to end the use of sexual violence as a weapon of war and armed conflict"{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-45759221|title=Nobel Peace Prize for anti-rape activists Nadia Murad and Denis Mukwege|access-date=5 October 2018}} |- |[[File:Olga Tokarczuk (2018).jpg|75px]] |{{sortname|Olga|Tokarczuk}} |[[Poland]] |[[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]] |“for a narrative imagination that with encyclopedic passion represents the crossing of boundaries as a form of life”{{cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/literature/laureates/2018/|title=Nobel Prize in Literature 2018|publisher=Nobel Foundation|accessdate=2019-10-10}} |- | align="center" | 2019 | [[File:Esther Duflo - Pop!Tech 2009 - 001 (cropped (2)).jpg|75px]] | {{sortname|Esther|Duflo}}
(shared with [[Abhijit Banerjee]] and [[Michael Kremer]]) | [[France]] and [[United States]] | [[Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences|Economics]] |"for their experimental approach to alleviating global poverty" Nobel Prize 2019 [https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/economic-sciences/2019/summary/ nobelprize.org] |} ==References== ;General {{refbegin}} *{{cite web|url=http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/lists/women.html|title=Women Nobel Laureates|publisher=[[Nobel Foundation]]|accessdate=2009-10-13}} {{refend}} ;Specific {{Reflist|20em}} ==External links== *{{cite web |url=http://www.svd.se/kulturnoje/understrecket/sa-ratade-akademien-kvinnorna_3573293.svd |title=Så ratade Akademien kvinnorna |first= |last= |author=Alan Asaid |date=26 September 2009 |work=[[SvD]] |publisher= |language=Swedish |trans-title=How the Academy Rejected the Women |accessdate= }} {{Nobel Prizes}} {{featured list}} {{DEFAULTSORT:List Of Female Nobel Laureates}} [[Category:Awards honoring women|Nobel]] [[Category:Lists of Nobel laureates|Female]] [[Category:Lists of women|Female]] [[Category:Lists of women writers|Nobel]] [[Category:Women Nobel laureates| ]]
